---
title: "Tarea 15. Pregunta 19.6."
---

### $(\Omega^{'},\mathscr{F}^{'})$ be another measurable space and Y a measurable function $Y:(\Omega, \mathscr{F}) \to (\Omega^{'}, \mathscr{F}^{'})$. If $\mbox{Im } Y = \{y_1, y_2, \dots, y_n\} \subset \Omega^{'}$ with $\mathbb{P}(Y = y_i) > 0$, $i = 1, 2, \dots, n$ then we have a measurable partition of $\Omega$ given by $\{B_i = (Y = y_i): i =1, 2, \dots, n\}$: If $\mathscr{A} = \sigma(Y)$ find $\mathbb{E}[X|\sigma(Y)]$ and $\mathbb{E}[X|Y = y_i]$, $i = 1, 2, \dots, n$.

---
Demostración:

\[
\begin{align*}
&\int_{B_i} \mathbb{E}[X|Y] d\mathbb{P} = \int_{B_i} X d\mathbb{P}\\\\
\implies&\int_{B_i} \mathbb{E}[X|Y=y_i] d\mathbb{P} = \int_{B_i} X d\mathbb{P}\\\\
\implies& \mathbb{E}[X|Y=y_i]\mathbb{P}(Y=y_i) = \int_{B_i} X d\mathbb{P}\\\\
&\therefore \mathbb{E}[X|Y=y_i] = \frac{1}{\mathbb{P}(Y=y_i)}\int_{B_i} X d\mathbb{P} &&(\forall\omega\in B_i) 
\end{align*}\]

Así 
\[\int_A\sum_{i=1}^n\mathbb{E}[X|Y=y_i]1_{Y=y_i} = \int_AXd\mathbb{P} \quad (\forall A \in \mathscr{A})\]
\[\therefore \mathbb{E}[X|Y] = \sum_{i=1}^n\mathbb{E}[X|Y=y_i]1_{Y=y_i}\]
